commit.message:
Fix issue due to colorbar for specific themes

fixes #424
Prepare changelog for release

TST: Change jitter & jitterdodge test images

position.transform_position uses DataFrame.apply calculate the new
positions for the geom. New positions that involve jittering change
the RandomState. Previous versions of pandas had DataFrame.apply
evaluate the first row/column twice while in pandas v1.1.0
DataFrame.apply evaluates the first row/colum only once. As the
number calls to the randomstate have changed, so have the test
images.

MAINT: pdtype.is_categorical is deprecated

in pandas v1.1.0

closes #425 #427
Bump pandas to v1.1.0

Remove utils.groupby_with_null

Pandas v1.1.0 now supports groupby with NA.
Change hasattr to callable (#421)

commit.message: TST: Regenerate failing tests after MPL 3.3.0

Fix colorbars with theme_matplotlib

fixes #403

Fix preserve='single' in position_dodge(2)

After this fix dodging with preserve='single' works for geom_text
and any other geoms that do no have 'xmin' and 'xmax' aesthetics.

closes #408
DOC: Add examples for scale_continuous.expand
DOC: Fix grammar error on index page

DOC: stat_summary fun_data returns named columns

closes #405

Fix plots without data but have good mappings

fixes #404
DOC: Correct tiny documenation alignment issue
Prepare changelog for release
MAINT: Add .readthedocs.yml & update sphinx config

Remove empty file

It was probably added by mistake in commit 34350062 by @TyberiusPrime.
Bump mizani to v0.7.1

Fix continuous scale mapping to discrete values

ref: #370

Fix theme of colourbar width and height

fixes #360
ENH: Print warnings on one line & no code

ENH: hint when 'hspace' and 'wspace' maybe needed

For facet_wrap, whene there are 2 or more rows (or columns),
and the respective scales are free, then the user may need
to adjust the spacing manually. This change tells the user
how to do it, when they may neeed it.

closes #344

DOC: Link to geoms, stats and positions

closes #391

TST: On cmdline, run flake8 when pytesting (#305)

* QoL: Flake8 test case

Replaces the Travis based flake8 linting
with a pytest test case. This eases the burden
on contributers to remember running flake8 before
submitting a PR and should speed up the travis runs a bit.

* Revert lint test changes to .travis.yml

* Remove unittest class, rely on pytest

- Do not report stderr messages as they usually contain
unnecessary warnings.

Co-authored-by: Hassan Kibirige <has2k1@gmail.com>

commit.message:
Support matplotlib path effects for text elements (#375)

* Support matplotlib path effects for text elements

Small addition but very useful to easily draw a stroke around text labels (e.g. https://matplotlib.org/3.1.1/tutorials/advanced/patheffects_guide.html#making-an-artist-stand-out)

* Add path_effects param to the DEFAULT_PARAMS

* Add link to patheffect documentation

Co-authored-by: Hassan Kibirige <has2k1@gmail.com>
